title: John Crosby: How the Beautiful Binds to the Broken -- The Sacred Journey from the Head to the Heart
description:
Karen has a conversation with John Crosby, interim pastor at Menlo Church in Menlo Park, California.  His path to faith ran through atheism to philosophy (blessed to be a student of the great Arthur Holmes). He distinguishes between the mode of philosopher and the mode of pastor. The pastor takes these important ideas and makes them accessible for life where it is lived in the trenches. 

His description of the impact of the resurrection is one for the ages.

Here's John's message on The Life of the Mind:  https://youtu.be/vFzcQ_n4PVw

Here's a study guide from John's message on The Life of the Mind:
https://d279tnhwytxyt3.cloudfront.net/SSG10.24.2021.pdf?mtime=20211022084345

Here's a link to the conversation with Matt Stephan that we mentioned:
https://youtu.be/-RBkoXrpqwU

I also realized I didn’t share the most important part of cleaning the room, which is learning that we don’t have the answers. That’s why everyone is looking for a church.
